messages.message: Do you think Abe Prowley would be a good person to invite to the Brainstorming thing? Also whatever time works for me. Next week is fine if we do it then.

Brian
I thought about that. He's usually tied up with game stuff, I don't know if he could be much help.
O cool cool.
Brian

Brian
Do you have an Arduino I could borrow?
no sorry.

Brian
ok, i think I am going to order one on sparkfun's free day
I may need to employ your help some weekend.
nice. sounds good. I'm down to help. whats your plan?

Brian
hook up a bunch of LEDs to a pair of pants.
and wear them to music festivals.
nice. that sounds pretty sweet.

Brian
yeah, I may need a little help with the circuitry, but once I get started they will be fun to write visuals for.
that would be pretty sick. pretty sick indeed.

Brian
I just tested it looks like I will be able to force LED prongs through the seams.
you can draw concepts for more than just engines right?
if I told you about another idea, could we work on some pictures of it so that I can find investors?
yeah maybe. It depends on what it is. And how big of project it would be to draw it.

Brian
I would find some way to compensate you.

alright but what is it?
you want to call me or tell me the next time your hear?
or over fb

Brian
basically it would be two or three pictures of people interacting with a light art display.  its a large white diffused globe, represented as maybe 2 stories tall, with another globe next to it to use as a spherical touch interface.
I think it would be possible using the touch sensing transistors we have today.
but there are projectors inside the global pointing outwards.
and whereever you move your fingers on the controll, the lights will point.
like....... hold on....

Brian
the software would allow DJs to control lighting manually in real time during their show.
both globes would be on stands.  they don't rotate, but the projector lights in the center come with servos
like those big black ones they use at concerts.
there would be 3 or 6 of them to cover the entire area of the globe.

Brian
its totally out there: https://www.google.com/search?q=maliable+touch+sensors&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&aq=t&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&client=firefox-a#hl=en&safe=off&client=firefox-a&hs=ZPZ&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&sa=X&ei=vQH1To_8M6mviQLo4dXQDg&ved=0CEIQvwUoAQ&q=malleable+touch+sensors&spell=1&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.r_cp.,cf.osb&fp=4b3c420078196b39&biw=1920&bih=1054

Brian
no one has ever put it together in an artistic way before.

this isn't what i was remembering but something like this? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vqKMsPaivgs
I"m a little confused about it.

Brian
yeah totally
damn
much like that but with a spherical touch interface to control it
like you program 3d gestures to switch visuals
and a much larger scale
and not shiny, that's lame
too much like from other sources reflecting off of it, it messes with the visuals.
more like the related videos
wait bigger. and it's by the dj or on the dance flour?

Brian
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sLKerArOsBQ&feature=related
it could have a controller for the DJ, or be a separate art display that audience members can play with.
so yes, very similar, different applications.
kind of like these: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzWt1FMvpOM&feature=endscreen&NR=1
that videos pretty cool

Brian
but not as static.

yeah that's cool. I'm not sure how well I can draw that in 3d though. I can draw a shere but putting all the colors in. I couldn't do that.
The software I use is mostly for designing metal parts.

Brian
oh yeah

Brian
how did you find that original video?
i looked up like 3d globe projector or something.

Brian
oh
I saw one before from another guy , I think it was this one. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=89mVBAHKqvg&feature=related

Brian
yeah

this one's pretty awesom http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w4i2fqc9q0U&feature=related
awesome*
Hey talk to you later man. Pieces.

Brian
bye

Brian
Dude, approve my Electric Life account so I can see your design.
What parts do we need to order?
I want to help pay and order extras for more projects with lots of LEDs
The PWM says (Tube 50) next to it, does that mean its only $1.75 for 50 in it or do you have to order in increments of 50 to get them in a tube?

Done
on digikey?
if it's digikey then yeah it's in orders of 50 probably to get that price
or orders 50 and above so you could get like 52 and it would be at that price

Brian
I saw the listing right on the TI website.
O hmm I don't know. if you digikey the part number. I bet you can find a better price

Brian
The MSP you selected, is there a board with the MIC and power LEDs and everything already mounted or were you thinking of ordering the boards?
* a board with the circuitry drawn.
?
Your schematic includes a lot of stuff like a power indicator.  I don't have the ability to solder a microchip.
Also red has a lower voltage, do we need more resistors or does the PWM handle that too?
I think I learn better from example, if you start wiring this, I'll be able to understand it better and duplicate it.  Otherwise I will need to take an EE class.  I can do the programming in C++ too, obviously.  That will be the fun part for me.
Any way we could power it off of 9V batteries?  Adding more in parallel will affect how long it can run right?

Brian
?
Your schematic includes a lot of stuff like a power indicator.  I don't have the ability to solder a microchip.
Also red has a lower voltage, do we need more resistors or does the PWM handle that too?
I think I learn better from example, if you start wiring this, I'll be able to understand it better and duplicate it.  Otherwise I will need to take an EE class.  I can do the programming in C++ too, obviously.  That will be the fun part for me.
Any way we could power it off of 9V batteries?  Adding more in parallel will affect how long it can run right?

link to the MSP430 Board?
yeah you can power it with a 9v
you shouldn't need a resisitor. It's built into the TLC5951 chip.
And yeah I'll wire this one and then we can work on the other led project after it's done.

Brian
sweet

Brian
Hey
What can we order more parts?
whatup

Brian
I want to help put it together.
Are you building the USB interface too?
Or does your diagram include the MSP430 breakout board parts too?

Hmm it has a microcontroller on the board.
I'm trying to figure out this one thing I messed up. I think I put to small of transistors on it. So now I'm trying to figure that out.
Maybe I didn't but I think I put two small of size on tehre.

Brian
oh right.
So the microphone can detect different frequencies and loudness right?
I mean we will be able to write the routine to do it, but it won't be limited by hardware?
What kind of values do you get back from that?  Some sort of digital signal that we have to interpret?

yeah it's just a analogue value.
So if the volume is up. The analoge reading is hight.
high*

Brian
oh right analog makes more sense.
but how do you do frequency then?

So to get like frequency's and stuff, we will have to do some sampling and stuff.
You have to sample and then do a FFT
it's more tricky.

Brian
oh ok
that's just an algorithm

Brian
check this out: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cDJLmZLmCfc&feature=related
I want to make LED bead curtains
for use in doorwars
*doorways

sick
yeah I've seen those tubes before that's cool

Brian
Yeah, I found the chinese company to buy them from and they offer samples.
I think 16x16x16 is the optimal resolution for voxel displays now.  Or at least that number of points, not necessarily in a cube.  That's 4096, I am not seeing any light displays less than that.
I am willing to invest a significant portion of my earnings to this.

Brian
I think 16x16x16 is the optimal resolution for voxel displays now.  Or at least that number of points, not necessarily in a cube.  That's 4096, I am not seeing any light displays less than that.
I am willing to invest a significant portion of my earnings to this.

haha cool
Yeah, hopefully this weekend I'll order all the stuff.
hmm maybe the part I thought didn't work will work. But I got to triple check later.

Brian
Are you printing the board already?

No I had to redo everything. But now it's just about done.
I got rid of the MSP430 On there. I'm just going to make a general board we can hook anything up to it. It will be better. There's a development board already out there that will work, and I don't have to solder a bunch of stuff together.

Brian
yeah, that's what I was thinking.
I pulled up the arduino software today.

cool
so it just finished routing.
I'm trying to get a build of materials ready. It's almost done. Then I'll send out an email and order everything tomorrow.

Brian
ok, will you get a me list of parts to make it?  and their link to digikey?
I can help pay for stuff.
It's cool it should only be like $60. And I'll keep track of what I spend
Yo G, Can't help you with that. I only got 4 pictures. And none of you. Sorry man.

Brian
Bummer.  Out of all the years we've spent together?
I guess people aren't organized like me.
Haha just because I didn't use my phone that weekend. I relied on others. I bet teresa or david has some of the mammoth trip on there fb. Maybe....
